text: The participation of Azerbaijan in the Bala Turkvision Song Contest first began in Istanbul, Turkey, at the inaugural Bala Turkvision Song Contest in 2015. Azad Azerbaijan TV (AATV) have been responsible for the selection process of their participants, since their debut in 2015. Nuray Rahman and Ahmed Amirli was the first representative for Azerbaijan at the Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2015 with the song "Cocukluk Yillari", which finished in first place out of thirteen participating entries, achieving a score of one-hundred and fifteen points. As of Bala Turkvision 2015, Azerbaijan have awarded the most points to , , , and . They have received the most points from , , , , , , and . ==Origins of the contest== Bala Turkvision is an annual song contest. Based on the similar format of the Junior Eurovision Song Contest, Bala Turkvision focuses primarily on participating Turkic countries and regions. A juror from each nation awards between 1 and 10 points for every entry, except their own. In the Grand Final the jury determines the winner. Unlike the Junior Eurovision Song Contest in which the winning country proceeds to host the following year's event, hosting of the Bala Turkvision Song Contest takes place in the country or region that is also hosting the Turkish Capital of Culture. ==History== ===Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2015=== On 4 June 2015, Azad Azerbaijan TV (AATV), announced that they would be making their debut at the Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2015, in Turkey. AATV confirmed on 14 August 2015, that they would use the television show, "Azərbaycanın səsi" (), to select their participant. Nuray Rahman and Ahmed Amirli were selected on 12 December 2015 to represent Azerbaijan in Istanbul, with the song "Cocukluk Yillari". they went on to win the contest. Azerbaijan won the inaugural contest achieving a score of one-hundred and fifteen points, from the other twelve competing countries. ===Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2016=== On 4 March 2016, Azerbaijan confirmed that they would be participating at the Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2016, and had selected Aydan Ilxasade, as their participant. However, on 8 December 2016, it was announced that both the Turkvision Song Contest 2016 and Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2016 had been delayed until March 2017, marking the first time since either of the inaugural contests, that a postponement had occurred. It was later confirmed that both of the 2016 contests had been cancelled due to the December 2016 Istanbul bombings. ===Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2017=== Azad Azerbaijan TV confirmed on 12 February 2017, that they would be competing at the Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2017. On 16 February 2017 it was announced that the Kazakhstan would be hosting the Bala Turkvision Song Contest 2017 at the Barys Arena, in Astana, Kazakhstan.
